original: Hultbom, Sten Carl August, advokat, Norrköping, f. 13/2/02 i Sthlm av C. F. H. o. Hildur Dahlen. G. 33 m. Märta Jonsson. Barn: Carl f. 36, Fredrik 39, Gustaf 42. — Stud:ex. 21, jur. kand. 26. Föret, ett flert. res. t. bl. a. Norge, Danm., Tyskl., Engl., Frankr. o. Höll. Tingstjg. 26-28, anst. å Lagercrantz & Daléns Adv:byrå 29, egen byrå i Norrköp. sed. 29. Om’b:-man o. sekr. i Norrköp. köpm:fören., Norrköp. hand:fören. o. KAK i Norrköp. 29, ordf. o. omb :man i Ostkustens auktor. strömmingsgross. fören. 41, ordf. i styr. f. Norrköp. Finans A-B 38, Esping & Lundell 40 o. Norrköp. Ljus-fabr. 41, led. av LStyr. f. Joh. Sjö A-B 41, v. ordf. i styr. f. A-B Falla Ångsåg 42, Svies färskfiskgross. förb. 43, Sv:es fiskintress. fören. 43 o. Sv. fiskhand :förb. gross :sektion 45. Led. av östergötl. jur:fören., KAK o. Sv. fi-latelifören. Hobbies : filateli, orientering, smalfilm. SkidhSm, Skidskytte-Sm. *Hultén, Gustaf Albert Selim, pro-vinsiaMäkare, Vrigstad, f. 25/10/89 i
translated:
Hultbom, Sten Carl August, lawyer, Norrköping, born on February 13th, 1902 in Stockholm to C.F.H. and Hildur Dahlen. Married in 1933 to Märta Jonsson. Children: Carl (born 1936), Fredrik (born 1939), Gustaf (born 1942). Graduated from high school in 1921, received a law degree in 1926. Had several business trips to Norway, Denmark, Germany, England, France, and Holland. Served as an assistant judge from 1926-1928, employed at Lagercrantz & Daléns law firm from 1929, and started his own law firm in Norrköping in 1929. Officer and secretary of Norrköping Merchant Association, Norrköping Trade Association, and KAK in Norrköping since 1929, chairman and officer of East Coast authorized herring wholesalers association in 1941, chairman of management board for Norrköping Finance A-B in 1938, and Esping & Lundell in 1940 and Norrköping Lighting Factory in 1941. A member of the board of Johann Sjö A-B in 1941, vice chairman of management board for A-B Falla Steam Sawmill in 1942, Swedish fresh fish wholesaler federation in 1943, Swedish fish interests association in 1943 and Swedish fish trade federation's wholesale section in 1945. A member of Östergötland's law association, KAK, and Swedish philatelic association. Hobbies include philately, orienteering, and small film. Won national championships in skiing and biathlon. 

Note: *Hultén, Gustaf Albert Selim, province surveyor, Vrigstad, born on October 25th, 1889. This person seems unrelated to Sten Hultbom's biography and is only mentioned at the end.

structured.name: Sten Carl August Hultbom
structured.description: Sten Carl August Hultbom was a notable lawyer based in Norrköping, Sweden. He was born on February 13th, 1902 in Stockholm to C.F.H. and Hildur Dahlen. He married Märta Jonsson in 1933 and had three sons: Carl (born 1936), Fredrik (born 1939), and Gustaf (born 1942). Hultbom graduated from high school in 1921 and went on to receive a law degree in 1926. He had several business trips to Norway, Denmark, Germany, England, France, and Holland. Hultbom served as an assistant judge from 1926-1928, was employed at Lagercrantz & Daléns law firm from 1929, and started his own law firm in Norrköping in 1929. He was an officer and secretary of Norrköping Merchant Association, Norrköping Trade Association, and KAK in Norrköping since 1929, chairman and officer of East Coast authorized herring wholesalers association in 1941, chairman of management board for Norrköping Finance A-B in 1938, and Esping & Lundell in 1940 and Norrköping Lighting Factory in 1941. He was also a member of the board of Johann Sjö A-B in 1941, vice chairman of management board for A-B Falla Steam Sawmill in 1942, Swedish fresh fish wholesaler federation in 1943, Swedish fish interests association in 1943, and Swedish fish trade federation's wholesale section in 1945. Hultbom was a member of Östergötland's law association, KAK, and Swedish philatelic association. He had hobbies in philately, orienteering, and small film. Hultbom won national championships in skiing and biathlon.
